p: Results from the charcoal meal intestinal transit model revealed that the crude extract of B. antidysenterica showed significant inhibition of intestinal transit at all test doses. The maximum antimotility effect was recorded in the highest dose of test extract 400 mg/kg (67.59%), which is comparable with the standard drug loperamide 3 mg/kg (67.35%, p < 0.001) (Table 2).
